column43: The mandate of the county education department is to improve the level of education in the county. As the County Education Director, I work in collaboration with the headteachers, payam education supervisors and the parents' teachers' association (PTA) to mobilize community to create awareness on ensuring that all children are sent to school. Currently, Jur River has a total of 275 schools (primary and  secondary). Out of this, only 19 schools are operating under permanent structure, with majority of the schools operating in either semi-permanent structures or under trees. In order to strengthen supervision of all the schools, the county education administration purchased 14  motor bikes for schools supervision. Out of which, 8 motor bikes are for county supervisors and 6 are for the payam supervisors who do weekly supervision.
